user_question: Under the pro mode to shoot, what is the function of the icon on right hand side of the icon that set white balance?

knowledge_chain.query: What is the function of the icon on the right-hand side of the white balance icon in pro mode?
knowledge_chain.raw_result:
The icon on the right-hand side of the white balance (AWB) icon in Pro Mode is the **Exposure Compensation** control, labeled as **"EV* 0"**.

This setting allows users to manually adjust the brightness of the photo. Increasing the EV value brightens the image (useful in low-light conditions), while decreasing it darkens the image (helpful in overly bright scenes). It provides fine-tuned control over exposure beyond automatic settings.

This control is accessible via a vertical slider in the PRO camera mode interface and is part of the manual photographic parameters that Pro Mode offers for advanced image capture.

### References

- [1] Smartphone Pro Camera Mode Interface Guide (image)
- [2] Pro Mode
- [3] Exposure Compensation
- [4] PRO Camera Mode
- [5] EV Exposure Compensation
knowledge_chain.summary: The icon on the right-hand side of the white balance (AWB) icon in Pro Mode is the Exposure Compensation control, labeled as 'EV* 0'. It allows users to manually adjust the brightness of the photo: increasing EV brightens the image (useful in low light), while decreasing it darkens the image (helpful in bright scenes). This control is accessible via a vertical slider and provides fine-tuned exposure adjustment beyond automatic settings.
